strategy_reasoning: Using a cozy 'retro RPG' aesthetic makes technical updates (like balance splitting and cache TTL) feel like game mechanics or inventory management, which resonates with our developer/gamer audience. The 'Seed 42' update is a perfect cultural touchpoint (Hitchhiker's Guide) to visualize as a special item.

images.prompt: Cozy pixel art title screen. A tiny 8-bit bee character hovering over a pixelated garden. Soft lime green (#ecf874) and lavender gradient sky. Chunky retro sprites. Text in pixel font: 'GARDEN UPDATES'. Warm lighting, lo-fi aesthetic like Stardew Valley. Nostalgic and welcoming.
images.description: Intro slide setting the cozy, nature-tech tone.

images.prompt: Retro RPG game UI inventory screen. Two glowing resource bars (like health/mana): one lime green labeled 'TIER', one soft purple labeled 'PACK'. Pixel art style. Soft pastel background. Cozy 8-bit aesthetic. Floating pixel nectar jars. Warm lighting, clean UI like Stardew Valley.
images.description: Visualizing the new two-column balance system (Tier vs Pack) as RPG stats.

images.prompt: A magical pixel art seed packet labeled '42' sitting on a wooden pixel desk. Soft lime green (#ecf874) magical glow around it. Cozy 8-bit aesthetic, chunky pixels. Warm lighting. A tiny pixel sprout emerging. Reference to 'Answer to everything'. Nostalgic gaming vibes.
images.description: Highlighting the documentation fix for Seed 42 (reproducibility).

images.prompt: A cute retro CRT monitor on a desk displaying a pixelated stability graph (line chart). A tiny 8-bit cup of steaming coffee next to it. Soft pastel room background. Cozy lo-fi vibes, warm lighting. Text '60m VIEW' on screen. Pixel art style like Unpacking.
images.description: Showcasing the new 60-minute aggregation window for better monitoring stability.

alt_text: A series of cozy 8-bit pixel art images. 1. A bee in a digital garden. 2. An RPG-style inventory screen showing Tier and Pack balances. 3. A magical seed packet labeled 42. 4. A retro computer monitor showing a stability graph. All in soft pastels and lime green.
